elements.title: Catalysis of an SN2 pathway by geometric preorganization (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Catalysis of an SN2 pathway by geometric preorganization

  • Gabriel J. Lovinger
  • Marcus H. Sak
  • Eric N. Jacobsen
Article18 Jul 2024

elements.title: The enduring world forest carbon sink (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The enduring world forest carbon sink

Data from boreal, temperate and tropical forests over the past three decades reveal that the global forest carbon sink has remained steady during that time, despite considerable regional variation.

  • Yude Pan
  • Richard A. Birdsey
  • Daniel Murdiyarso
Article17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Symbolic recording of signalling and cis-regulatory element activity to DNA (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Symbolic recording of signalling and cis-regulatory element activity to DNA

Enhancer-driven genomic recording of transcriptional activity in multiplex (ENGRAM) is used for multiplex recording of the cell-type-specific activities of dozens to hundreds of cis-regulatory elements with high fidelity, sensitivity and reproducibility.

  • Wei Chen
  • Junhong Choi
  • Jay Shendure
ArticleOpen Access17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Giant chiral magnetoelectric oscillations in a van der Waals multiferroic (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Giant chiral magnetoelectric oscillations in a van der Waals multiferroic

Precision measurement of the dynamical magnetoelectric coupling in an exfoliated van der Waals multiferroic shows a giant natural optical activity at terahertz frequencies.

  • Frank Y. Gao
  • Xinyue Peng
  • Edoardo Baldini
ArticleOpen Access17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Superconductivity in pressurized trilayer La4Ni3O10−δ single crystals (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Superconductivity in pressurized trilayer La4Ni3O10−δ single crystals

The application of pressure effectively suppresses the spin–charge order in trilayer nickelate La4Ni3O10−δ single crystals, leading to the emergence of superconductivity.

  • Yinghao Zhu
  • Di Peng
  • Jun Zhao
Article17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Inhibition of IL-11 signalling extends mammalian healthspan and lifespan (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Inhibition of IL-11 signalling extends mammalian healthspan and lifespan

IL-11 is identified as a key regulator of ERK–AMPK–mTORC1 signalling, metabolism, inflammation and age-related disease and lifespan in mouse and human.

  • Anissa A. Widjaja
  • Wei-Wen Lim
  • Stuart A. Cook
ArticleOpen Access17 Jul 2024

elements.title: An engineered enzyme embedded into PLA to make self-biodegradable plastic (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
An engineered enzyme embedded into PLA to make self-biodegradable plastic

Embedding of a new engineered thermostable hydrolase into polymer materials enables the production of biodegradable and home-compostable plastics suitable for industrial packaging applications.

  • M. Guicherd
  • M. Ben Khaled
  • A. Marty
Article17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Thresholds for adding degraded tropical forest to the conservation estate (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Thresholds for adding degraded tropical forest to the conservation estate

An analysis of the impact of logging intensity on biodiversity in tropical forests in Sabah, Malaysia, identifies a threshold of tree biomass removal below which logged forests still have conservation value.

  • Robert M. Ewers
  • C. David L. Orme
  • Cristina Banks-Leite
ArticleOpen Access17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Adaptation to photoperiod via dynamic neurotransmitter segregation (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Adaptation to photoperiod via dynamic neurotransmitter segregation

Changes in day length, conveyed by the preoptic area, drive axonal neurotransmitter reorganization in median raphe dual serotonin–glutamate neurons to regulate behaviour and sleep timing, highlighting a photoperiod-sensitive brain circuit.

  • G. Maddaloni
  • Y. J. Chang
  • S. M. Dymecki
Article17 Jul 2024

elements.title: A hot-Jupiter progenitor on a super-eccentric retrograde orbit (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A hot-Jupiter progenitor on a super-eccentric retrograde orbit

The spectroscopic and photometric observations of a high-mass, transiting warm Jupiter, TIC 241249530 b, with an orbital eccentricity of 0.94, provide evidence that hot Jupiters may have formed by means of a high-eccentricity tidal-migration pathway.

  • Arvind F. Gupta
  • Sarah C. Millholland
  • Carl Ziegler
ArticleOpen Access17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Psilocybin desynchronizes the human brain (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Psilocybin desynchronizes the human brain

Healthy adults were tracked before, during and after high doses of psilocybin and methylphenidate to assess how psychedelics can change human brain networks, and psilocybin was found to massively disrupt functional connectivity in cortex and subcortex with some changes persisting for weeks.

  • Joshua S. Siegel
  • Subha Subramanian
  • Nico U. F. Dosenbach
ArticleOpen Access17 Jul 2024

elements.title: A eukaryotic-like ubiquitination system in bacterial antiviral defence (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A eukaryotic-like ubiquitination system in bacterial antiviral defence

A study reports the structure and molecular mechanism of the Bil anti-phage defence system, demonstrating that it is the closest prokaryotic homologue of canonical eukaryotic ubiquitination pathways.

  • Lydia R. Chambers
  • Qiaozhen Ye
  • Kevin D. Corbett
Article17 Jul 2024

elements.title: A holistic platform for accelerating sorbent-based carbon capture (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A holistic platform for accelerating sorbent-based carbon capture

A framework that integrates materials, process design, techno-economics and life-cycle assessment can be used to accelerate the development of carbon-capture technology as we aim for a net-zero world.

  • Charithea Charalambous
  • Elias Moubarak
  • Susana Garcia
ArticleOpen Access17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Identification of plant transcriptional activation domains (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Identification of plant transcriptional activation domains

A high-throughput yeast-based assay is used to identify more than 1,500 activation domains (ADs) in Arabidopsis transcription factors, and a deep learning approach applied to this dataset can predict AD activity on the basis of sequence features.

  • Nicholas Morffy
  • Lisa Van den Broeck
  • Lucia C. Strader
Article17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Position-dependent function of human sequence-specific transcription factors (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Position-dependent function of human sequence-specific transcription factors

The effect of transcription factor binding on transcription initiation is dependent on the position of the transcription factor binding site.

  • Sascha H. Duttke
  • Carlos Guzman
  • Christopher Benner
ArticleOpen Access17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Groundwater-dependent ecosystem map exposes global dryland protection needs (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Groundwater-dependent ecosystem map exposes global dryland protection needs

Mapping of groundwater-dependent ecosystems, which support biodiversity and rural livelihoods, shows they occur on more than one-third of global drylands analysed, but lack protections to safeguard these critical ecosystems and the societies dependent upon them from groundwater depletion.

  • Melissa M. Rohde
  • Christine M. Albano
  • John C. Stella
ArticleOpen Access17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Singular dielectric nanolaser with atomic-scale field localization (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Singular dielectric nanolaser with atomic-scale field localization

Singularity enables breaking the optical diffraction limit in a dielectric nanolaser.

  • Yun-Hao Ouyang
  • Hong-Yi Luan
  • Ren-Min Ma
Article17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Mechanical release of homogenous proteins from supramolecular gels (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Mechanical release of homogenous proteins from supramolecular gels

A stiff hydrogel gel is presented that encapsulates and stabilizes proteins without additives or excipients and uses mechanical strain to release them, offering low-cost and versatile delivery of therapies.

  • Simona Bianco
  • Muhammad Hasan
  • Dave J. Adams
ArticleOpen Access17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Clonal inactivation of TERT impairs stem cell competition (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Clonal inactivation of TERT impairs stem cell competition

Studies in mice show that telomerase reverse transcriptase (TERT) has a role in enhancing stem cell competition that is independent of its reverse transcriptase activity, and promotes chromatin accessibility and activity of the MYC oncogene.

  • Kazuteru Hasegawa
  • Yang Zhao
  • Steven E. Artandi
ArticleOpen Access17 Jul 2024

elements.title: Sources of gene expression variation in a globally diverse human cohort (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Sources of gene expression variation in a globally diverse human cohort

A new open-access RNA sequencing dataset, MAGE, of 731 individuals across geographically diverse human populations provides a valuable resource to study genetic diversity and evolution and expands the capacity to identify new genetic associations.

  • Dylan J. Taylor
  • Surya B. Chhetri
  • Rajiv C. McCoy
ArticleOpen Access17 Jul 2024
